spans.text: ......It's already morning.
It's already the morning of the third day.
The sun rises as usual, and the sparrows start disturbing the peace at five in the morning as usual.
——This means she's been in the dark drum room for a whole day and night.

Out of consideration for public morals and neighborly relations, Rikki made significant upgrades to the soundproofing of the drum room as soon as she moved into her new home, and also installed double-layer light-blocking curtains to enhance concentration.
Thanks to this, she was able to break four drumsticks in a frenzy in the middle of the night without being knocked on by angry neighbors or the police.
——But she wouldn't hear the knock anyway.

It was in this closed room, which should have isolated her from all external changes, that Taki still felt the arrival of morning and subconsciously muttered the words of excitement and guilt mixed together by those who stayed up all night.

In countless days, she personally felt the night flowing under her feet, and the connected day slowly rising from her side. The sound pressure, air, and gravity of the world descended upon her in an enlightening change, as if the Earth was giving the poor souls who were still awake at night a live performance of its rotation.
But right now, Taki hated this instinct to perceive changes in time.

She clearly wanted to avoid seeing anything related to time that she hid in the drum room, violently venting before curling up under the fortress-like drum set, seeking meaningless security in the emptiness.
After a long time, a small patch of light came from her feet, and Taki slightly raised her head.
It was the heart rate wristband she had stubbornly brought in last night, which had automatically connected to her phone's Bluetooth at some point, reminding her that a friend had updated their SNS.
(Is it Anon again...)
She was about to bury her head again when she caught a glimpse of the first few words of the post on the small screen.
"...updated a post——Raana Kaname: [Image]"
Because the screen lit up, Taki still saw the time she didn't want to see: 6:15.
Raana is up this early?
Instantly, only this one question remained in Taki's world.

Originally, Raana's SNS was as quiet as a missing person, and now this kind of person wakes up early in the morning and posts an update—it's not like Anon Chihaya, who has to post an Instagram story to show off even if she wakes up early from insomnia.

Too curious, Taki picked up the wristband, but couldn't click into the details. After all, the wristband only serves as a notification function, and she can only go back to the bedroom to get her phone if she wants to see the specific content.
Whew.
Cats are like that, always unexpectedly surprising at strange moments.
But, I also have to thank her for making me realize that I can still be curious.
Taki stood up with the wristband in hand, able to find the direction of the door even in the darkness.
But she accidentally kicked a broken drumstick, and the splinters pricked her foot painfully.
That's dangerous... I have to clean it up later.
